title: Structured Debriefs
content: Debriefs turn experience into learning. Structure matters: what happened, what we expected, why the gap, what we'll do differently. Without structure, debriefs become blame sessions or self-congratulation. Focus on the decision process, not just outcomes. Extract lessons that improve future decisions.

mcq.question: After an incident, the debrief focuses on who made the mistake. What's the problem?

options.B: Blame focus misses systemic factors and doesn't improve future decisions
options.C: The person responsible needs to know

mcq.explanation: Blame-focused debriefs miss why the error was possible, what conditions contributed, and what system changes would prevent recurrence. Individual blame rarely improves organizational decision-making.

openQuestions: How effective are debriefs in your operation at improving future decisions?
What structure works best for decision-focused debriefs?
